monogr.title: The first booke of cattell : wherein is shewed the gouernment of oxen, kine, calues, and how to vse bulles and other cattell to the yoake, and fell. With diuers approued remedies, to helpe most diseases among cattell: most necessarie for all, especially for husband men, hauing the gouernment of any such cattell. Gathered and set forth by Leonard Mascall
monogr.author: Mascall, Leonard

keywords.term: Agriculture, viticulture, texts on hunting, veterinary science

lg.l: THou husband man, that faine wouldst know,
Some remedies to find:
How for to helpe thy sickly beast,
To satisfy thy mind.
Here maiest thou learne plentie thereof,
Thou needs not farther go:
But therein search, and thou shalt find
Such helpes to helpe their woe.
And when thou wouldst faine cattell keepe,
For to maintaine thy stocke:
Thou must then learne as well the helpes
As to increase the flocke.
For if thou seekest first the beast,
And knowst not how to vse him:
When he fal'th sicke, alwaies thou art,
In danger for to loose him.
For want of knowledge and good skill,
Oft times it maie so fall:
A man that is full rich in beasts,
He maie soone loose them all.
Therefore in this I councell thee,
Seeke first to helpe disease:
As great a praife to him that saues,
As he that can increase.
